com.tigertext.ttandroid.conversation

Class ConversationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tigertext.ttandroid.conversation.ConversationManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ConversationManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Created by gautamkanwar on 7/9/15.

    This class is one point source for handling all the message related operations like

    1. Sending Message 2. Resending Message 3. Recalling message 4. Deleting Message etc

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ConversationManager.GetParticipantsListener 
      static interface  ConversationManager.ParticipantsListener
      This listener should be used to get collection of user objects, along with continuation for paginated calls.

      • recallMessage

        public void recallMessage(@NonNull
                          java.lang.String messageId)
        This call will recall the message locally with .

        If the message has already been sent to the server, it will recall the message on the server.

        If the message is currently sending to the server, it will wait until the message is sent, and then it will recall the message locally and on the server.

        Parameters:
        messageId -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when is null or 0-length.

      • sendAttachment

        public void sendAttachment(Message msg,
                           boolean shouldDeleteAttachment)
        Send generated message with an attachment
        Parameters:
        msg - Generated message
        shouldDeleteAttachment - If true, SDK will delete the given attachment once it is encrypted (useful for temporary files) else, SDK will not delete the attachment (useful for system files such as Gallery images)
        See Also:
        Message.messageForSend(java.lang.String, com.tigertext.ttandroid.RosterEntry, long, java.io.File, java.lang.String, boolean)

      • sendAttachment

        public void sendAttachment(@NonNull
                           java.io.File file,
                           java.lang.String mimeType,
                           java.lang.String messageBody,
                           RosterEntry rosterEntry,
                           int ttl,
                           boolean dor,
                           SendMessageListener listener)
        Sends an attachment. If roster doesn't exist in the roster list, it will be created as well.
        Parameters:
        file - Attachment file
        mimeType - Attachment mime type
        messageBody - (Optional) message to go with the file

        throws IllegalArgumentException if the file, mimeType, or rosterEntry is null, if the file does not have read permissions, if the file is a folder, or if the file is not a supported type.

      • isAttachmentStoredLocally

        public boolean isAttachmentStoredLocally(java.lang.String messageId)
        Check whether an encrypted attachment is available on the device. Useful for checking if the file exists to avoid fetching the attachment from the server to save data.
        Parameters:
        messageId - id of the message attachment to be checked
        Returns:
        true if encrypted file is already stored on the device, false if attachment has to be fetched from the server.
        See Also:
        getAttachment(String, String, String, ConversationListener)

      • markMessagesRead

        public void markMessagesRead(java.lang.String[] messageIds)

      • markConversationAsRead

        public void markConversationAsRead(RosterEntry rosterEntry)
        Marks all messages in this conversation as 'Read' 1. Gets all message ids with NEW or DELIVERED status

        If there are any messages, continue thru steps 2 - 4.

        2a. Marks all messages with NEW or DELIVERED status in message table for the roster as READ. 2b. In the same task, updates the roster's unread count to 0 and decrements the organiztions unread count by the number of unread counts that roster had before marking NEW or DELIVERED messages as READ. 3. Update the organization in the OrganizationManager, since the instance is now stale due to the change in unread count. 4. Make request to server to mark the message ids retrieved @ step 1 to be marked as READ. This is done last because by notifying the server of the change in status, we will receive SSE events of the new status change. These SSE events can cause errors in unread counts due to the timing in which they arrive and in which we decrement the counts.
